channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A snowboarder and a skier land the first 2340s in competition
item.description: Japanese snowboarder Hiroto Ogiwara and Italian skier Miro Tabanelli pulled off the six-and-a-half-rotation maneuver in competition for the first time in history.
item.content:encoded:
Japanese snowboarder Hiroto Ogiwara and Italian skier Miro Tabanelli pulled off the six-and-a-half-rotation maneuver in competition for the first time in history.

(Image credit: Ezra Shaw)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Israeli troops fire on displaced Palestinians hoping to return to homes, killing 2
item.description: Meanwhile, close to the Israeli border in southern Lebanon, Israeli troops opened fire on protesters, killing 22 and injuring 120, according to Lebanese officials.
item.content:encoded:
Meanwhile, close to the Israeli border in southern Lebanon, Israeli troops opened fire on protesters, killing 22 and injuring 120, according to Lebanese officials.

(Image credit: Omar al-Qattaa)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: DeSantis faces pushback by fellow Republicans on his call for an immigration session
item.description: Republican leaders in the state legislature say they support President Trump's pledge to combat illegal immigration but want to deal with it and other issues identified by DeSantis on their schedule, not his.
item.content:encoded:
Republican leaders in the state legislature say they support President Trump's pledge to combat illegal immigration but want to deal with it and other issues identified by DeSantis on their schedule, not his.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Trump says he still wants to buy Greenland, suggests Canada could become a U.S. state
item.description: The newly inaugurated president held forth on multiple foreign policy issues on Saturday, from Greenland to Canada to the war between Israel and Hamas.
item.content:encoded:
The newly inaugurated president held forth on multiple foreign policy issues on Saturday, from Greenland to Canada to the war between Israel and Hamas.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Rain gives LA wildfire relief but officials warn of mudslides and toxic ash
item.description: Rainfall could cause mudslides in area burned by wildfires, with officials warning residents of toxic material from debris and ash.
item.content:encoded:
Rainfall could cause mudslides in area burned by wildfires, with officials warning residents of toxic material from debris and ash.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: South Korean prosecutors indict impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol over martial law
item.description: South Korean prosecutors on Sunday indicted impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol on rebellion in connection with his short-lived imposition of martial law.
item.content:encoded:
South Korean prosecutors on Sunday indicted impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol on rebellion in connection with his short-lived imposition of martial law.

(Image credit: Jeon Heon-Kyun/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How did the newt cross the road? With the help of the Chileno Valley Newt Brigade!
item.description: In northern California, a group of volunteers spend every night from late fall through winter as crossing guards–escorting migrating salamanders across a rural road.
item.content:encoded:
In northern California, a group of volunteers spend every night from late fall through winter as crossing guards–escorting migrating salamanders across a rural road. 

(Image credit: Stephanie O'Neill)
item.dc:creator: Stephanie O'Neill

item.title: A minister was acquitted of a brutal 1832 murder. A new book revisits the case
item.description: In the world of true crime, Fall River, Mass. is known for Lizzie Borden, but another murder 60 years earlier captivated New England. Kate Winkler Dawson tells the story in The Sinners All Bow.
item.content:encoded:
In the world of true crime, Fall River, Mass. is known for Lizzie Borden, but another murder 60 years earlier captivated New England. Kate Winkler Dawson tells the story in The Sinners All Bow.

(Image credit: Melissa Gray)
item.dc:creator: Melissa Gray

item.title: Jayden Daniels could make Super Bowl history. Doug Williams says it's about time
item.description: Washington Commanders' Daniels could become the first rookie quarterback to play the Super Bowl. Williams, who led the team to a Super Bowl win, says talented Black QBs are finally getting their due.
item.content:encoded:
Washington Commanders' Daniels could become the first rookie quarterback to play the Super Bowl. Williams, who led the team to a Super Bowl win, says talented Black QBs are finally getting their due.

(Image credit: Nic Antaya/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Jannik Sinner beats Alexander Zverev in 3 sets to win second Australian Open in a row
item.description: Jannik Sinner claimed his second consecutive Australian Open championship on Sunday, never facing a single break point and using his complete game to outplay and frustrate Alexander Zverev for a 6-3, 7-6 (4), 6-3 victory in the final.
item.content:encoded:
Jannik Sinner claimed his second consecutive Australian Open championship on Sunday, never facing a single break point and using his complete game to outplay and frustrate Alexander Zverev for a 6-3, 7-6 (4), 6-3 victory in the final.

(Image credit: Vincent Thian/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
